episodes.summary:
Movies Movies Movies! Like we always say: hooray for Hollywood! 

This week, Tim and Tom take Tinseltown as we preview this summer's hottest blockbusters. (Actually, in this episode we mostly talk about movies coming out in April and May.) But the main event is Tom's complex reaction to the new Batman v Superman movie, which was not very good.

We also solve a problem from a listener who needs to travel across the country with a couple of cats.

episodes.title: Spring Break
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week we're taking a break... a SPRING BREAK that is! We're talking about all the hot spot destinations for spring break like Florida! Also this week we solve a lister problem concerning a mouse but not from a mouse.

Today’s sponsor is Casper Mattresses - obsessively engineered American-made mattresses at a shockingly fair price. And now, you can get $50 toward any mattress purchase by going to casper.com//guide and using code GUIDE

episodes.title: Civilian Space Travel
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
Blast off with your best buds Tim and Tom as we talk about civilian space travel. That's right, some billionaires are trying to make it possible for schlubs like us to go to space, which seems like a really bad idea. We also talk about public drinking laws in New York City, going to the movies with teenagers and we solve a problem from a guy whose roommate hasn't showered in weeks.

episodes.title: Popcorn
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
Popcorn, get your fresh popcorn! This week we're talking all about the treat that's a treat to eat: popcorn. How does corn turn into popcorn? What are the different ways to make popcorn? Why doesn't Tim like popcorn? All of these questions and more are answered on this week's episode.

episodes.title: The Chupacabra
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary: This week, we have a brand new installment in our TCGTE Myths and Legends series. We talk about the infamous goat sucker, the chupacabra and uncover some truly alarming facts. Also, Tim has some stories about riding the bus and we solve problems from a lady looking for love and a child politician.

episodes.title: Bagels
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
Bagels, bagels, bagels. This week we’re talking about the ol’ bready treat known as bagels. Toasted, untested, cream cheese, butter, New York-style, Montreal-style, we don’t shy away from any bagel-related topic. Also this week Tim discusses his trip to the magical Build Your Own Burger McDonalds that Tom visited a few weeks ago as well as his Valentine’s Day run-in with Rainbow Bagels.

Also this week we celebrate the return of the Mundane Bucket List and we solve a listener problem involving a couple’s escalating prank war.

episodes.title: Childhood Ambitions
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
Ever wonder what the tiny, child-versions of Tim & Tom wanted to be when they grew up? What were our hopes and our dreams? The answers may shock you.

Also, Burger King announces it'll serve hot dogs, Tom has a question about the Super Bowl and we solve a problem about old love letters.

episodes.title: Groceries
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week Tim and Tom are talking Groceries, something that neither of them thought to shop for until very recently. We're talking fruits, we're talking vegetables, are we talking meats? You're damn right we're talking meats. No stone is left unturned.

Also this week we solve a listener's problem concerning how to make an acquaintance into a friend without being a real weirdo about it.

episodes.title: Rebranding
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
Questions about branding? You've come to the right place. This week we're talking about rebranding efforts: Radio Shack, Pizza Hut, Dr. Pepper and a bunch of other brands have switched things up in a misguided attempt to appeal to young folks, and all of them paid a terrible price for doing so. Can we rebrand The Complete Guide to Everything to appeal to a new, hip audience? But first, Tom takes a magical trip to a new McDonalds with a magical touch screen.

Also, we solve a problem from a listener with a co-worker who is a boring drunk.

episodes.title: Snow
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary: There's a blizzard a-comin'! As we prepare for the biggest snow storm to hit NYC in decades, we're talking all things snow: childhood memories, panicked rushes on the supermarkets for bread and milk, and building disappointing snowmen. We also come up with a foolproof plan to avoid snowstorms altogether in the future. And in a new installment of Tim and Tom Solve Your Problems, we help out a chef who can't seem to keep her subordinates out of jail.

episodes.title: Glasses
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week we’re talkin’ glasses. It turns out they’re not just for nerds anymore because now Tom needs them too. Mostly this is just an episode where Tom complains, first about the Post Office, then about the process of getting an eye exam and buying glasses. Also, Tim answers a lot of Tom’s burning questions about the ins and outs of glasses ownership. Then at the very end we talk about how everyone admirable has been dying lately and it’s really sad.

This episode is brought to you by Loot Crate. Would you classify yourself as a geek, gamer or popculture nerd? Then this is the subscription box for you. Make sure to head to lootcrate.com/GUIDE and enter code GUIDE to save $3 on any new subscription!

episodes.title: Sensory Deprivation
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary: This week we're hittin' the tanks! We took a field trip to a new age-y place to get into sensory deprivation tanks. Was it fun? Did Tim lose his mind forever? Did Tom travel through the cosmos and discover the meaning of life? Listen and find out what we learned by lying down naked in some salt water in the dark for an hour.

episodes.title: Ska With Dan Deacon
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary: Our old buddy and acclaimed music guy Dan Deacon stops by to ring in 2016 and talk about ska music, Santa Claus and a bunch of weird stuff with us. We also solve a couple listener problems in a special edition of Tim & Tom & Dan Solve Your Problems.

episodes.title: Chocolate
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary: For the last episode of 2015, we talk about chocolate, the only food that Tom eats without complaining. We discuss the Mast Brothers controversy in detail and consistently mispronounce the word cacao. Also, Tim has a heartwarming holiday encounter in a pizza place.

episodes.title: T&TSYP
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary: We've had to skip solving problems for the past few weeks so this week we're doing nothing but (solving problems that is.)

episodes.title: US Mail
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary: The Mail's here! Ha ha, just kidding, but we are talking about it this week. Soon you'll be able to look at pictures of your mail before you get it and maybe even do your banking at the post office. Plus Tim has some ideas about how the mail can be improved.

episodes.title: Stand - Up Comedy
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary: This week we talk about that thing people in suits do with a microphone in front of a brick wall: stand-up comedy. Things get a little heated when we go through a strange list of best-ever comedians from 2005. Also, Tom tries to start a feud with an actor that nobody has ever heard of.

episodes.title: RPGs
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
Another thrilling installment of Tom Explaining Something Nerdy to Tim! This week we’re talking about Role Playing Games, or RPGs, something Tom barely understands himself. We’re talking all about everything from Dungeons and Dragons to Fallout 4. 

We also solve a problem with how to deal with an acquaintance who is also a jerk. A jerkquaintance, if you will.

Socks and underwear use to be a boring stocking stuffer, but Mack Weldon has changed it into a top- of-the-line gift. The Mack Weldon holiday packs are not just a gift that every man needs, it's the gift that every man is excited to get. Go to mackweldon.com and get 20% off using the promo code: EVERYTHING

episodes.title: Public Relations
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
Public Relations is a hard job. This week we talk about the PR efforts behind a new TV show (Tom was invited to a fancy premiere party), Adele’s new album and Justin Beaver: The Dancing Boy.

We also solve a problem that is super ridiculous.

HEY NEW YORK! Come to our live Holiday Spectacular at Union Hall in Brooklyn on December 4th. Get tickets at tcgte.com/live.

episodes.title: Pizza
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
Can you believe we've never done an episode about Pizza? I mean, we probably have, but we couldn't find it listed anywhere so here it is. You'll find out our favorite toppings, least favorite toppings, and opinions about non-New York pizza which may surprise you!

Also we solve a problem relating to where to find a quiet place to propose in NYC.

This week's episode is sponsored by TransferWise. TransferWise is the smart way to send money abroad. Head to transferwise.com/completeguide and your first transfer up to $500 will be free!

episodes.title: The Moon
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week we talk about the moon and whether or not it is actually made of cheese. Also, Tom gets a flu shot, Tim becomes a skeptic and we solve a problem from a listener who isn't sure whether or not to move in with his grandmother.

This week's episode is sponsored by Prudential. Visit bringyourchallenges.com for more information.

We're also brought to you by Audible. Get a free audiobook of your choice and a free 30 day membership at audiblepodcast.com/everything.

episodes.title: Hoverboards
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary: The future is here, but not the future we were promised. This week we're talking about hoverboards, from Back to the Future 2, to real experimental hoverboards, to these weird self-balancing scooters that people are calling hoverboards. Also this week we solve a listener problem involving unwanted street violence.

episodes.title: Halloween Candy
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week two candy enthusiasts talk about candy for a while. We also discuss the spookiest Halloween songs, Tom considers what his life would be like as a drug addict and we solve a problem from a reasonable young woman whose friend is being a big jerk.

This week's episode is sponsored by TransferWise, the smart way to send money abroad. Head to transferwise.com/completeguide and your first transfer up to $500 will be free!

episodes.title: Back to the Future
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary: This week Tim gets scared by a scarecrow and we're talking about Tom's favorite movies of all time: the Back to the Future trilogy. Also, we solve a problem concerning an elementary school teacher who has to tutor her boyfriend.

episodes.title: NYC Comic Con 2015
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary: Well, the comic book convention rolled into town, so we put on our journalist hats and hit the floor of NYC Comic Con 2015. In this episode we talk about our experience amongst the crowds, Tom eats a Halloween-themed Whopper and we feature another installment of the occasional series "Tim's Tales of Cowardice." Also, Tom talks about Batman a lot, probably.

episodes.title: Pretty Woman
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary: Look, sometimes in the podcast game you pick the topics and sometimes they pick you. And then sometimes you pick the topic but instead wind up talking about Pretty Woman for an hour instead. This week is one of those times. Also Tom lends his wisdom and experience as a former RA to solve a problem facing a new RA.

episodes.title: Podcasts
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary: This week we talk about podcasts, a topic that we theoretically know a lot about. We also talk about the Pope's visit to New York (will a certain special guest drop by the TCGTE studio??) and we solve a problem from a barber who places lots of bets. Honestly, things kind of go off the rails in this episode.

episodes.title: Burning Man
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary: Burning Man. Is it a free-wheeling, anything goes festival where people go to find themselves through art and expression, or is it just baloney. The Complete Guide to Everything investigates (by reading things on the internet and making wild assumptions). Also Tim talks about his Bing gambling problem and we solve a problem involving us of all people.

episodes.title: Apple TV
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week we talk about the new Apple products, as we do at least twice a year. Will Tim wake up at 3 a.m. to buy the new iPhone? Will Tom buy a new Apple TV despite already owning many devices that do the same thing? Tune in for the answers to these questions and much more!

Also, we discuss self-help books, big bags of M&Ms and the logistics of air traffic control.

episodes.title: TV Show Tapings
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary: This week Tim and Tom went to a test show of the new Late Show with Stephen Colbert but they're not really allowed to talk about it. So instead they talk about all the other weird TV show tapings they've been to, as well as their differing opinions of Miley Cyrus and Sesame Place. Also a listener question involving breaking and entering by a neighbor is solved.

episodes.title: McWhopper
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary: This is it. The episode topic this show was made for. This week we discuss Burger King's proposal to team up with McDonald's in the name of world peace (or something) and create a hybrid Big Mac and Whopper. We talk about the wide-ranging effects of this newsworthy event, create our own fast food hybrids and debate the ethics of getting a chicken addicted to cigarettes.

episodes.title: Bad Luck
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary: This week we're talkin' 'bout the idea of bad luck. Specifically, how Tom managed to lock himself out of his home, break his computer, and more all in one week. We also talk about some other superstitions and solve a listener problem involving buying stolen property.

episodes.title: Berenstain Bears And The Mandela Effect
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week we talk about the internet's obsession with the spelling of the children's book series The Berenstain Bears and delve into the weird world of the Mandela Effect. It turns out, if you misremembered something, you might not be wrong; it's possible you are a traveler from a different parallel dimension. Seriously.

Also, we talk hoverboards (as always), Tim has an important message about The Muppets and we solve a problem from a man who can't stop tilting his head in photographs.

episodes.summary:
Tom pitches Tim a billion dollar bathroom business. We also discuss the many, many rules of etiquette in the big city, from subways to walkways. A problem involving lying about quitting a job just to go work right down the block is also solved.

episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week we have stars in our eyes! We discuss the various celebs we've met throughout the years and the stupid things we've said to them. We also talk about a bunch of other random stuff because NYC is in the middle of a heat wave so brutal that we can't even think straight.

episodes.title: Foo Fighters
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
It's Foo Fighters week on The Complete Guide to Everything. That's because Tim and Tom saw the Foo Fighters last week at Citi Field. This week we talk all about Foo Fighters, the basis for Tim and Tom's original friendship in the 1990's. We also go through each album, naming the best, worst and sleeper hits of each until we get to the albums where we don't recognize any songs any more.

episodes.title: Taco Bell
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week we're heading for the border and thinking outside the bun, cause we're talkin' Taco Bell. We go in-depth about the most bizarre of the major fast food chains and deconstruct their current and former menu items. 

Also, Tom has a lot of opinions about famous dogs and we stumble on a million dollar idea that would be an absolute game-changer at McDonald's.

episodes.title: Fallen Heroes
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week we’re talking about famous people everyone loves who turned out to be (alleged) monsters. Mostly we’re talking about Jared from Subway, Bill Cosby and Tom Selleck. We also talk about current hero and non-alleged monster Tyrese Gibson who has built a Starbucks in his backyard.

T&TSYP this week tackles a listener problem concerning pissing off a friend’s chicken.

This episode is brought to you by Amazon! July 15th is Prime Day with HUGE discounts. Be sure to visit tcgte.com/amazon to check them out and support the show.

episodes.title: Apple Music
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week we're talking about the hot new entrant into the streaming music game: scrappy young upstart Apple. We also discuss Donald Trump's PR strategy, Tom Hanks' recent career choices, cracking wise on a lifeboat and, as is required by law whenever talking about anything music industry-related, Taylor Swift.

Additionally, we solve a problem from a listener who can't stop reading his emails in a goofy accent.

episodes.title: Mobile Games
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week we're talkin' mobile gaming and some Arkham Knight, even though it's not a mobile game whatsoever.

We also solve a problem involving some complicated political issues relating to high school student government.

episodes.title: Fan Theories
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week, we talk about a thing that everyone on the internet is required to talk about at some point: fan theories. You know that movie or TV show you like? Well, you're never going to believe what's REALLY happening in it. It turns out half the characters are secretly dead and most of the scenes are fever dreams and coma fantasies.

This week's episode is brought to you by:
Uncle John's Bathroom Reader - Go to bathroomreader.com/everything to download a free mini eBook.

episodes.title: Escaping From Prison
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week we’re talking all about the recent prison break in upstate New York which hopefully hasn’t come to a horribly tragic end by the time you listen to this.

Also discussed: Tim’s depressing lunch at Quizno’s, the idea of toasted burritos, a puppet restaurant, lockdowns, Tim’s near run-in with the Hammerman, real life Harley Quinn, dirty prison underwear, the governor of New York being on the case, US Marshals.

episodes.title: Tim And Tom Solve Your Problems Yet Again
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
You all have been sending us your problems and dang it, we always try our hardest to solve 'em. This week we devote the entire episode to helping out our listeners, save for some talk about Night Court and America's Funniest Home Videos.

This week's episode is brought to you by:
Uncle John's Bathroom Reader - Go to bathroomreader.com/everything to download a free mini eBook.

"In Praise of American Educators" - Learn more at www.solution-tree.com/inpraise

episodes.title: Treating Yourself
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week Tom decides that he deserves a look into how the other half lives and treats himself to a luxuriously long massage.

We also discuss friend of the show Ben Affleck’s problems with his wife and neighbors as well as annoying subway bongo players.

Our live shows in London are coming up soon (JUNE 25, 26 & 27) so you should buy tickets right now at tcgte.com/live. Thursday night is 50 Shades of Tim and Friday night is Dating Part 5: Online Dating!

episodes.title: 2015 Summer Movies
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week is our annual summer movie preview, recorded after several of the year's biggest blockbusters have been released and already forgotten. Since loud, dumb summer movies are basically created for people like Tom, we've created the Tom-Scale™ of movie ratings so you can keep track of which movies are worth your time.

But first, we announce the extremely exciting and very sexy topic for our first show in London this year. By the way, the shows are coming up soon (JUNE 25, 26 & 27) so you should buy tickets right now at tcgte.com/live.

Also, Tim tries to find a venue for his birthday party that isn't a bar, and we solve a problem from a listener about iced coffee.

episodes.title: Mattresses (Part One Of The Bed Series)
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
What conversation about mattresses would be complete if it didn’t start with 20 minutes of Tim complaining about Tom’s new Apple Watch and ignoring Tim’s text message? After that, we talk about the new mattress Tom bought from the internet, the time Tim got duped into paying an extra $200 for a mattress by a mattress salesman, mattress protectors and spilling wine/wetting the bed and a tease for future bed episodes.

This week we also solve a problem from a listener who found a bunch of undeveloped film rolls in hiding place in the old shed of the new home he bought.

episodes.title: California
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary: This week we kinda talk about the great state of California, a place where we have each been a couple times and have some vague opinions about. Also, Tim is sick, Tom gets a new water filter and we solve a problem from a listener who has a weird mental picture of the two of us.

episodes.title: HGTV
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary: This week we're talking Home and Garden Television, or HGTV to the layperson. Flip or Flop, House Hunters, House Hunters International, Property Brothers, you name it. (Mostly just those though.)

episodes.title: Birthdays
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
It's Tom's birthday, so he gets to talk about whatever he wants this week. Oddly, he chooses to talk about the subject of birthdays. 

Also: Tom doesn't get his Apple Watch in time for his birthday, Tim has a bus adventure, we contemplate the future of Marvel movies and a fact about a talking horse creeps us both out. And in a new installment of Tim & Tom Solve Your Problems, we help a listener with his ringtone quandary.

This week's episode is sponsored by Shari's Berries! Get freshly dipped strawberries starting at $19.99 by going to berries.com, clicking on the microphone and entering the code "Brooklyn."

episodes.title: Bruce Willis
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary: It’s the return of Bruno. Not really, but we talk a lot about Bruce Willis, his musical alter-ego Bruno, and his sci-fi film career.

episodes.title: Area 51
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
Do you want to know more about aliens hidden at secret government facilities? 

Do you want to see Donald Trump kiss a bunch of people on television? 

Do commercials for toilet paper make you irrationally angry?

If you answered yes to these questions, this is the podcast episode for you!

This week's episode is brought to you by Loot Crate - go to lootcrate.com/everything and enter code "EVERYTHING" to save $3 on any new subscription!

episodes.title: Cars Of The Future!
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week we’re talking cars of the future, like Tesla, Google’s Self-Driving Car, Hyperloop, Apple’s Car and more. Also this week we hear about how Tom fell down in the street along with the riveting tale of how Timmy Baloneyskins became Timmy Meatballs.

Hey New York City! We're doing a show in Brooklyn on 4/10 at Union Hall. We have to keep the topic secret because we're afraid to announce it publicly, but we promise it'll be worth your while. Get tickets at tcgte.com/live.

episodes.title: Starbucks
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week's episode is about a chain of coffee shops that also sells easy listening music and always has a bathroom for you to use when you need one.

Also this week: Tim has some ideas for spoons, we salute the hard work done by bookies everywhere, and we solve a problem from a listener about her dogs.

Hey New York City! We're doing a show in Brooklyn on 4/10 at Union Hall. We have to keep the topic secret because we're afraid to announce it publicly, but we promise it'll be worth your while. Get tickets at tcgte.com/live.

episodes.title: Buying A Car
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
Tom’s had an interesting week in regards to popcorn and being a tough guy. Also, Tim and Tom argue about the logistics of stretch limo hot tub maintenance before getting to the topic at hand: buying a car. Neither is buying a car, but that doesn’t stop them from discussing it.

Also, a problem is solved in relation to vacationing with a family friend in NYC.

HEY NEW YORK! Come see us in Brooklyn on 4/10. Tickets at tcgte.com/live.
HEY LONDON! Come see us in London on 6/25, 6/26 and 6/27. Tickets at tcgte.com/live.

episodes.title: Minecraft
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week we discuss Minecraft, the worldwide phenomenon that somehow Tim was completely unaware of. Luckily Tom is there to explain it all. Then we hatch schemes to live inside our Minecraft creations when the technology is finally available. We also talk about Bill Gates' magical video walls and what we would do with the giant letters from Yankee Stadium.

This week's episode is brought to you by Loot Crate - go to lootcrate.com/everything and enter code "EVERYTHING" to save $3 on any new subscription!

We're also sponsored by Audible. Get a free 30-day trial and audiobook of your choice at audiblepodcast.com/everything.

episodes.title: Harrison Ford
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
A heated debate concerning TGI Friday’s Endless Apps takes up about half of this episode, but we do eventually get to talking about Harrison Ford. Who is Harrison Ford you ask? Why, he was in Star Wars, Indiana Jones, Blade Runner, you name it and so do we, in this episode. Mostly we talk about him crashing a plane into a golf course though.

We also solve a listener problem concerning moving out of the sticks to the big city.

This week’s episode is sponsored by Loot Crate. They’ll deliver you a monthly box with 6-8 cool items like vinyl figurines, comics, shirts, and more - and each month has a theme. Go to lootcrate.com/EVERYTHING and enter code EVERYTHING to save $3 on any new subscription!

episodes.title: Sneakers
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week it's all about the shoes. Ya see, we're talking about sneakers, and we don't mean the 1992 film starring Robert Redford and Dan Aykroyd. We're talking about actual sneakers that you wear on your feet and Tom tells a story about designing his custom Nikes.

We also talk about how the obnoxiousness of the Jersey Boys musical and solve a problem from a listener about an annoying co-worker.

HEY NEW YORK! Come see us in Brooklyn on 4/10. Tickets at tcgte.com/live.

episodes.title: Toy Fair
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week Tim and Tom go to Toy Fair! But first, a frank discussion about how the subway tracks are cleaned, then it's on to Toy Fair! A place where they apparently don't give out free toys but will let you hurt yourself on a remote control skateboard if you ask them.

We also try to solve a listener problem regarding an arranged marriage!

episodes.title: Kanye West
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week we talk about polarizing musician Kanye West because the world needs to hear more opinions about him. This episode contains the most passionate defense of Kanye from a guy who doesn't really care from him that you'll hear all week.

Also Tim goes to a high class magic show and Tom tries to get him to explain all the tricks.

episodes.title: Vaccines
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary: Hot topic alert! This week we’re talking about vaccines. Who’s getting them, who’s not getting them, you name it. Also we talk about the logistics of storing your own blood and making a new skeleton. Also we solve possibly the most embarrassing listener problem we’ve ever received.

episodes.title: Microsoft
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week's episode is about Microsoft, a company that makes software and computer stuff. We talk about the majesty that is Windows 95, as well as some of their newer hit products like the Zune.

We also solve a problem from a listener about feeding vegans at his wedding.

This week's episode is brought to you by Harrys.com, which sells shaving supplies. Save $15 and get a chrome engraved Winston set for just $25 by using the coupon code EVERYTHINGVALENTINE.

episodes.title: Basketball
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
Basketball. B-ball. Tim and Tom went to a Brooklyn Nets game this week and now they've both got a bad case of basketball fever. They also talk about how terrible both of them are at basketball and the various levels of humiliation it has caused them throughout their lives.

Also, a problem involving being too young to buy fish at an aquarium is solved.

episodes.title: Joining A Gym
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week Tom joins a gym and has some very big plans for how the rest of his life will play out. Also, Tim is afraid of teens he sees on the bus. And in a new installment of Tim & Tom Solve Your Problems we solve a problem from a listener whose parents are potentially stealing his hard earned money.

This week's episode is sponsored by Audible. Get a free 30 day trial and an audiobook download of your choice by going to audiblepodcast.com/everything.

episodes.title: Cereal
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary: It’s the topic that the entire podcasting world is talking about: Cereal. This week we’re talking all about that stuff you eat in the morning that is mostly sugar. From Cap’n Crunch variants to the multitude of monster cereals on the market, we cover it all this week.

episodes.title: Secret Menu Items
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
From "animal style burgers" to burritos wrapped in quesadillas to unofficial McDonald's sandwiches with really disgusting names, we're talking about secret menu items this week. Ya know, for people who like to go into a fast food joint and order "off the menu."

Also, Tim explains the Gilmore Girls to Tom and we have a very special announcement regarding the Tim & Tom Solve Your Problems theme song!

episodes.title: 2014 Year In Review
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary: 2014 kinda stunk but it is our solemn duty to still recap it. This week we're talking all things 2014, along with bureaucracies, fingerprinting, North Korea and predictions for 2015, the year the hoverboard finally becomes a reality.

episodes.title: Stephen King
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
It's Christmastime, so this week we're doing an episode about noted horror novelist Stephen King. This guy does it all: writes books, has movies made based on his books, produces miniseries based on the same books successful movies have already been based on, and predicts the future in the books written by his pseudonym.

Also, Tom gets a weird contraption for his back and we solve a problem from a listener who expects us to figure out his whole life for him.

episodes.title: Mars
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
Mars. The Red Planet. We've all heard of it, but how many of us have actually been there? The answer may surprise you. The answer is none. None of us have actually been there. But that's not going to stop us from talking about Total Recall, Terraforming, One-Way Trips, Biodomes and everything else you need to know about if you want to go to Mars.

Also we solve a problem about a listener's friend who raps all the time.

episodes.title: Christmas Trees
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week we get in the holiday spirit and talk about Christmas trees. Tim helps Tom decide whether he should get a real tree that will make his dog sick and probably catch on fire, or a fake tree that will require him to empty out an entire room of his apartment for storage. 

We also take a look at reviews of classic books written by dumb children and solve a "problem" someone has because they get too much free wine.

If you're doing your holiday shopping on Amazon this year, consider using tcgte.com/amazon. It's the same old Amazon, but your buddies Tim and Tom get a cut.

episodes.title: Soda
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary: This week we're talking the fizzy stuff. Ya know, soda. All kinds of soda, but mostly just the mainstream stuff from Pepsi and Coke. Also this week we answer a listener problem concerning a boyfriend who might have a name fetish.

episodes.title: Uber
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week we talk about the recent controversies surrounding Uber, the car service run by bros. This somehow leads to heated conversation about the development of a real life Hoverboard.

We also bring back the popular segment "A Particular Type of A****** You Didn't Know Existed Until The New York Times Pointed Them Out To You" and solve a listener problem from a young married woman.

You can help us out by going to podsurvey.com/guide and taking a short, anonymous survey about your interests. If you do it, you'll be entered into an ongoing monthly raffle for a $100 Amazon gift card.

episodes.title: Toys R Us
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
The toy-giving season is coming up, and this week we're talking about the mother of all toy stores: Toys R Us. We talk about how difficult it was to get there as a child, the horrible idea of letting kids "test" toys while making their wish lists, the logistics of buying a video game as a child and FAO Shwarz, the high end toy store recently bought by Toys R Us. 

Also Tim has a foul smelling misadventure on the bus, Tom has some internet problems and we solve a problem about smoking cigarettes.

Hey, did you can support the show and get some cool rewards? Check it out at tcgte.com/pledge.

episodes.title: Florida
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week Tim just can’t stop talking about Florida, where he just got back from tour and where he did not go to Disney World. Also Tim’s body can’t process alcohol, there are now Cronuts at Dunkin Donuts, the return of a classic segment Mundane Bucket List and the guys solve a problem about what to do when adults want to be your friend.

You can help support TCGTE and get all kinds of cool rewards on Patreon at tcgte.com/pledge.

And Tom has a new book out! You can get it at tcgte.com/tom.

episodes.title: Taylor Swift
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week we talk about the polarizing pop star Taylor Swift in a manner befitting two men in their 30s who have a tenuous grasp on what young people enjoy. We trace her career from her roots in country music to her current role as Global Welcome Ambassador for New York City, a place she has lived for 6 months. Oh well. Haters gonna hate hate hate hate hate.

On this episode we also announce our Patreon campaign, which includes a new mini-podcast called Amazing Facts. If that sentence doesn't make any sense to you, check out tcgte.com/pledge for more info.

And Tom has a new book out! You can get it at tcgte.com/tom.

episodes.title: Halloween Parties
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week we're talking Halloween parties. What to eat at 'em, what games to play, costumes to wear, you name it. If it's something you can or should do at a Halloween party, we're talking about it this week.

We also solve a listener problem concerning what to do when you receive a gigantic framed print as a gift and don't want to put it up in your house.

episodes.title: Comic Con
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week we discuss a topic near and dear to Tom's heart: comic book conventions. We somehow obtained press passes to New York Comic Con, and we pulled out all the stops! (Actually, we just brought a tiny recorder with us and we kinda screwed it all up.)

Listen as Tom gets excited about Batman stamps and Tim gets frightened by large crowds. Hear stories of Tom getting mad at everyone he encounters and Tim leaving and never coming back. 

Also, Tim gets very tired because he watches too many late night talk shows and Tom has issues with people wearing Google Glass.

episodes.title: Arcades
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
Arcades are back, and now you can drink alcohol there even if you aren’t a juvenile delinquent! This week we’re talking about the rise of “barcades” as well as remembering back to the arcades of our youth and Tom’s obsession with Sega’s Time Traveler holographic video game. Also, Tim and Tom discuss the upcoming New York Comic Con and solve a listener problem about what to do when an annoying co-worker wants to be your real life friend.

This week's episode is brought to you by Audible. Get a free 30 day trial and an audiobook download of your choice by going totcgte.com/audible.

episodes.title: NYC Subway Vs London Tube
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week, we discuss a recent article in The Guardian in which a British journalist trashed the New York City subway system for being needlessly confusing and extremely disgusting. In the interest of fairness, we, as New Yorkers, discuss our impressions of the London Tube and rationally compare the two public transportation systems in a calm and reasonable manner.

Also this week, Tom shows off his new iPhone that he bought after doing some ridiculous research, and we solve a listener's problem that causes Tim to reevaluate the way he lives his life.

Read the original article about the NYC subway at the Guardian's website: http://www.theguardian.com/commentisfree/2014/sep/23/new-york-subway-homesick-london-underground-mta-map

This week's episode is brought to you by Audible. Get a free 30 day trial and an audiobook download of your choice by going to tcgte.com/audible.

episodes.title: Derek Jeter
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week we discuss the retirement of one of baseball's brightest stars, Derek Jeter. If you don't know anything about Derek Jeter, don't worry -- we bring you up to speed very quickly. We also talk about a few of the more surprising aspects of his life, some of which are pretty shocking.

But first, we discuss Tim's recent trip to Iceland, Tom's casting decisions for the Captain Marvel movie and the acclaimed film Rounders 2. And in a new installment of Tim & Tom Solve Your Problems, we tackle a question about a baby that says swear words.

episodes.title: Comic Book TV Shows (Fall 2014)
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week Tim’s on vacation so A.J. joins Tom to talk about something Tim would never want to: all the new comic book superhero TV shows coming to TV this fall. Tim and A.J. talk Tom’s trip to the NYC premiere of Gotham, the new season of Arrow, The Flash, Constantine, Marvel’s Agents of S.H.I.E.L.D. and more.

The guys also help an engineering intern try to figure out how to make his office stop smelling like fish in order to get him a job.

episodes.title: Apple Watch
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week we’re talking about the latest gizmo to completely change the world and allow you to finally forget about all of your problems: Apple Watch. Also, Tom explains to Tim the video game Destiny and we solve a listener problem concerning not liking seafood.

This week's episode is brought to you by Amazon. Did you know that they now sell more than just books? It’s true! They started selling other stuff about 10 years ago. You can find out all about it at tcgte.com/amazon.

episodes.title: NYC Trendy Food
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
Cronuts, ramen burgers, gourmet chicken nuggets, who can keep track of all of these new trendy foods that you have to wait in line for hours and hours to acquire? We can, despite not having eaten many of the items. This week we run down the list of the hottest food trends in New York City and tell you why they’re stupid.

Also, Tim and Tom solve a problem regarding a marriage proposal at a concert.

This week's episode is brought to you by Audible. Get a free 30 day trail and an audiobook download of your choice by going to tcgte.com/audible.

episodes.title: Memes
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
If you're a person that uses the internet (and we suspect that you are), then one thing is for certain: you can't get enough MEMES!!!! In an episode we can't believe we haven't done in the past, Tom explains some of the most popular internet memes to a skeptical Tim. Naturally, this is followed by a fair amount of confusion, as well as a discussion of presidential hamburger-eating habits.

But first, we talk about how we're celebrating Labor Day 2014 and give a definitive answer to a classic airplane etiquette question. And in a new installment of Tim & Tom Solve Your Problems, we help out a guy who needs to choose between romancing a bunch of girls over the internet or saying with one girl in real life. 

This week's episode is brought to you by Audible. Get a free 30 day trail and an audiobook download of your choice by going to tcgte.com/audible.

episodes.title: Emergency Preparedness
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
If there’s an emergency, are you prepared? You are if you have THIS episode. Tim and Tom discuss all the things you need to have in case of an emergency, like a hand crank radio, dehydrated food and constant entertainment.

This week we also introduce a new segment called “Taking Care of Business” and solve a listener problem relating to Facebook birthday blues.

This week's episode is brought to you by Audible. Get a free 30 day trail and an audiobook download of your choice by going to tcgte.com/audible.

episodes.title: Ice Cream
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
We're smack dab in the middle of summertime, so this week we're talkin' ice cream. And boy oh boy, do we have a lot of opinions about ice cream. If you enjoy listening to two grown men talking about desserts very passionately, this is the episode for you. We also coin a new phrase that is sure to take the world by storm, and solve a listener's problem about when to shake hands and when to hug.

This week's episode is brought to you by Audible. Get a free 30 day trail and an audiobook download of your choice by going to tcgte.com/audible.

episodes.title: Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary: It’s Tim and Tom Talkin’ Teenage Mutant Ninja Turtles! Except neither of them has seen the new movie, so mostly it’s just talking about the old movies, TV shows, video games, action figures, comic books, ice pops, pizza, etc. Also, Tim reveals what he played with as a child instead of action figures like a regular kid!

episodes.title: Personal Hygiene
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week we cover it all, folks: from baths to showers to brushing your teeth. Everything you need to know about proper personal hygiene is covered. Plus we explore a minor plot point in Back to the Future which may not make any sense, Tom refuses to explain why a cab hailing app has deemed him "influential," and Tim says something gross that needs to be bleeped out. Also we solve a problem from a listener that may or may not be made up. 

This week's episode is brought to you by Audible. Get a free 30-day trial and an audiobook of your choice by signing up at tcgte.com/audible.

episodes.title: Summer Concert Series
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
Summertime. You know it, we know it. What does it bring? Concerts! Sometimes these concerts have not one, not two, but sometimes three or more bands! We call these "summer concert series" sometimes.

This week we talk about this young man's game as well as the time Tim and Tom went to see Radiohead and didn't understand how concerts work.

episodes.title: Fitness Trackers
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week, Tim tries to rebrand the podcast as a resource for consumers to compare products, beginning with fitness trackers in this episode. Tom doesn't seem all that interested in this plan and spends more time thinking about they lyrics of Stevie Wonder songs. Also, Tim is ready to leave New York City for good because his car was towed.

This week's episode is brought to you by Audible. Get a free 30 day trial and an audiobook download of your choice by going to tcgte.com/audible.

episodes.title: Haunted Houses
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week we’re talking all about haunted houses! Ohhhhhhhhh! Scary! All kinds of haunted houses, from the dinky ones at small-time amusement parks like Adventureland, where Tim shut down an entire ride, to haunted walking tours all about horrific deaths. Also we solve a listener’s problem having to do with some inappropriate photos on a work computer.

This episode is brought to you by Audible. For a free 30 day trial and an audiobook download of your choice, sign up at tcgte.com/audible.

episodes.title: Charles Manson
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week we talk about Charles Manson, a man famous for horrible things. Please be warned: Tim and Tom share what may be a somewhat controversial opinion: we don't like him. We make no apologies for this fact.

Also we talk about old department stores and giving gum to the animals at the zoo! We also introduce our brand new segment "The Complete Guide Mailbag." Get in on the fun by sending us mail! Here's our address:

The Complete Guide to Everything
P.O. Box 395
Greenpoint
Brooklyn, New York 11222-0395

This episode is brought to you by Audible. For a free 30 day trial and an audiobook download of your choice, sign up at tcgte.com/audible.

episodes.title: Horse Racing
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week we talk about Tim's trip to the horse track, which did not go well for him. Things go a little off the rails when we discuss the lineage of certain horses and what constitutes a "good horse." There's also a lot of talk about drinking smoothies, buying life-sized wax figures of George Clooney and opening a dangerous amusement park, as well as a staggering amount of product placement. 

In a brand new installment of Tim & Tom Solve Your Problems, we tackle a young man's question about an uncle who steals his cigarettes.

This episode is brought to you by Audible. Get a free 30 day trial and an audiobook of your choice by going to tcgte.com/audible.

episodes.title: World Cup 2014 Brazil
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
World Cup Fever! This week we’re talking all about the world’s favorite sport: Non-American Football. Mostly though we talk about how Tom enjoys soccer, Tim is indifferent to it and they both agree that a lot of people in Brooklyn pretend to like it when the World Cup happens. Also the return of our world famous segment, The Mundane Bucket List.

This week’s episode is sponsored by The Complete Guide to Everything, who encourage you to check out The Complete Guide to Everything: After Dark Volume 2! That’s right, another collection of exclusive episodes we recorded with 7 of our besties that are available only on this custom limited edition 4GB USB drive. Over 10 hours of content for only $20 right over at tcgte.com/store!

episodes.title: Algernon After Dark
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week, we offer you a taste of our other show, The Complete Guide to Everything: After Dark, mostly because we don't have an actual episode to put out. So instead, please enjoy this episode from the vault (recorded a couple years ago). If you've heard this episode already, we apologize. But listen to it again, maybe you'll hear some stuff you didn't pick up on the first time! 

We'll be back next week with a regular episode. Promise.

episodes.title: Going Off The Grid
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
Have you ever wanted to disappear completely and never be found? Are you afraid that sinister forces are watching your every move, and just wish you could get away from it all? Well, you probably won't find any practical information in this episode, but you will hear Tim & Tom contemplate how difficult it would be to live off the grid. Also, Tom floats the prospect of replacing Tim on the podcast with his dog, Tim shaves his beard out of paranoia, and we discuss what to do if you smell terrible and don't know it. 

In a new installment of Tim & Tom Solve Your Problems, we give advice to a teenager about how to properly channel teen angst.

This week's episode is brought to you by Audible. Get a free 30 day trial and an audiobook download of your choice, go to tcgte.com/audible.

episodes.title: Soylent
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week we talk about the future of food, Soylent. If you don't know, Soylent is a goo that was created by tech industry folks that provides all the nutrients your body needs [probably], eliminating the need to eat regular food. It seems really weird, and the dude who invented it sounds kind of like a jerk. We discuss this, and also Tom gets angry at people who call pasta sauce "gravy."

In a new installment of Tim & Tom Solve Your Problems, we help out a young person who has trouble scheduling a study schedule.

Oh, and hey, Manchester and London: We are in your cities this week! There are still some tickets available and we would love to see you. Go to tcgte.com/tour for more info!

episodes.title: Conspiracy Theories (Night 2 in Manchester 2013)
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
The second night in Manchester as part of last year's UK/Ireland tour! Hear us talk all about crazy conspiracy theories from the internet, play games with the audience and solve problems LIVE on stage!

If you're in Ireland or England there's still time to grab tickets! (Sorry Scotland, sold out.) Get all the info and buy tickets at tcgte.com/tour.

episodes.title: Twitter
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week we’re talking about the hot new website Twitter.com! We also spend an inordinate amount of time talking about a Morrissey Twitter account that turned out later in the week to be fake. From now on we’ll wait until the absolute last minute to record as always to make sure all of our facts are straight.

Hey! We're coming to the UK and Ireland in less than a month! Get all the info and buy tickets at tcgte.com/tour.

episodes.title: Summer Movie Preview 2014 Part 2
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
Last week's episode was so wildly popular, we've extended the party for another hour! Because we only discussed a few of the blockbusters being released this summer, we are bringing you a second part of our annual Summer Movie Preview. Among the movies we talk about are Think Like A Man Too, Jupiter Ascending and Guardians of the Galaxy. Naturally, this leads to talk of the Matrix, Ghost Dad and for some reason, Family Feud.

Also, Tom explains another bizarre dream, Tim mades a critical podcasting blunder, and we solve a problem from a listener who can't get his roommate to stop banging away on drums all day and night.

Hey! We're coming to the UK and Ireland in less than a month! Get all the info and buy tickets at tcgte.com/tour.

episodes.title: Summer Movie Preview 2014
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week Tim's sick for a change and we're talking about the summer movies of 2014. Which summer movies of 2014 you ask? Well I'm so glad you asked. How about a little movie called X-Men: Days of Future Past! Or what about another tiny indie movie called GODZILLA!?! There's a few other as well since we only got up to about June before running out time since the plots of all the X-Men movies had to be explained to Tim in detail by Tom.

The magic talk wraps up with a remembrance for The Masked Magician who revealed all the magician's secrets on Fox, before finally leading up to what everyone's come here for: Tom's thoughts on Ben Affleck as Batman.

episodes.title: Another Episode About Video Games
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week, we were all set to record a thrilling episode all about magic and magicians, with a bunch of super interesting anecdotes and jokes, but then Tom started talking about video games and when Tom starts talking about video games, well, it's kinda hard to stop him. You just gotta let him tire himself out.

So video games it is, folks. We talk about the newest systems that will be hitting the market later this year: the XBox One and the PS4, as well as why Grand Theft Auto is actually bad for society and why it is that the trashiest kids in your elementary school had the most video game systems. Also, Tim considers the value of video games when you reach a point in your life when you realize all your hopes and dreams have died.

This week's episode is brought to you by Audible. Get a free 30 day trial and a free audiobook download by going to tcgte.com/audible.

episodes.title: Trains
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
Tim finally crosses off an item on the ol' Mundane Bucket List by finally staying in a sleeper car on a train. This week we're talking about riding the rails, whether it's via First Class like Tim or hoping in an open box car as it ambles through a country field. The future of train travel is also discussed as we debate the merits of Elon Musk's "Hyperloop", which will get you from San Francisco to Los Angeles in under 30 minutes by going 1,102 km/h. This of course leads to an intellectual argument about musks and colognes.

Finally this week we also officially unveil the winner of the Tim and Tom Solve Your Problems Theme Song Sweepstakes and solve a listener problem concerning being blocked on all social networks after telling off a friend.

This week's episode is brought to you by Audible. Get a free audiobook download and 30-day trial by signing up at tcgte.com/audible.

episodes.title: Tim And Tom Solve Even More Of Your Problems
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week we put on our problem solving pants and dig into the ol' mailbag for an episode-length version of Tim & Tom Solve Your Problems. We solve problems about sharing a home with your significant other, asking a girl out on a date in a world in which John Lennon has devalued the concept of love (this one's a little complicated) and having your co-workers think you've fathered a child that you haven't.

We also unveil a new crop of entries in our contest to find a Tim & Tom Solve Your Problems theme song. (Go over and vote for your favorite at facebook.com/completeguide.)

Also, Tom isn't allowed to talk about Doctor Who, and is incensed by Tim's 20+ minute rant on the topic of Jeopardy Kids Week. But seriously, something pretty awful happened on Jeopardy this week, and Tim just wants to be sure that a young contestant gets the recognition he deserves.

This week's episode is brought to you by Audible. Get a free 30-day trial and audiobook download by going to www.tcgte.com/audible.

episodes.title: Batman Vs. Superman  The Movie
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week we're of course talking about a movie that isn't coming out for two years, doesn't even have an official title, and very little information has been released about: Batman Vs. Superman. Also this week we discuss Tim's upcoming train vacation and go over five entries into the new Tim and Tom Solve Your Problems song contest, almost half of which are disqualified immediately. We also solve a listener email about whether he should try to date his best friend's sister long distance.

This week's episode is brought to you by Audible. Get a free audiobook download and 30-day trial by signing up at tcgte.com/audible.

episodes.title: Being Lazy
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week, on account of the obscenely high temperatures in New York, we discuss the best ways to be lazy. Ya know, to conserve energy and whatnot. From dropping off your laundry at a laundromat with a surly hipster employee instead of doing it yourself, to buying an electronic Spin the Bottle game so you don't have to spin some bottle like a rube just to kiss somebody in the context of a game situation, we have every lazy trick covered.

Also, in a new installment of Tim & Tom Solve Your Problems, we give advice to a high school ski bum who doesn't think wooing girls is worth his time.

This week's episode is brought to you by Audible. Get a free 30 day trial and audiobook download at tcgte.com/audible.

episodes.title: Amazing Facts!
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week, Tim and Tom vie for the coveted title of Factmaster General of TCGTE in an epic showdown of incredible proportions. We try to outdo each other with amazing facts, to see who has the number one most amazing fact of all amazing facts. We relay some interesting info about the Three Stooges, the Empire State Building, the human brain, the universe and much more. 

Also, we talk about building RVs for New York City living, the legality of touching parked cars that don't belong to you and the second book of the Hunger Games.

This week's episode is sponsored by Audible. Get a free 30 day trial and audiobook download by visiting tcgte.com/audible.

episodes.title: The Beach
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week we're talking about one of everyone's favorite summer destinations: the beach! Well, more specifically we're talking about Tim's trip to the beach this week that ended up with his arm in a sling. Also discussed: illegal ice cream vendors, new types of beach bros that are really into knowledge in all its forms, terrifying things in the ocean like sea snakes and some summer beach tips. Lastly we solve a listener problem concerning what to do in a lab over the summer when everyone else is gone.

This week's episode is brought to you by Audible. Get a free audiobook download and 30-day trial by signing up at tcgte.com/audible.

episodes.title: Board Games
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week, Tim and Tom tackle the riveting topic of board games, which contrary to popular belief are not games you play when you're bored, but rather games that you play with a board. We discuss Tom's secret to Trivial Pursuit success, the "re-discovered" actual rules to Monopoly and tailoring a version of Guess Who to college fraternities.

But before all this, Tim has a question about proper deli ordering procedure and we try to get to the bottom of what Elmer Fudd was really doing out there in the woods. In a new installment of Tim and Tom Solve Your Problems, an amateur sleuth from the UK asks for advice regarding a bathroom situation at work.

This week's episode is sponsored by Audible. Get a free 30 day trial and audiobook download at tcgte.com/audible.

episodes.title: Dog Fostering
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary: This week a discussion of the elaborate post-production process that each episode goes through and Tim gets taken to the cleaners at the local lube shop. Also, Tom fosters a dog which of course leads to a heated discussion about Webster versus Diff'rent Strokes. The rest of the episode is pretty much just a blow by blow recounting of Tom's fostering a dog which is later revealed to have spent almost the entire episode snotting into Tim's sweatshirt.

episodes.title: Superman
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
It's a bird! It's a plane! It's two guys sitting around talking into microphones about Superman for a little while!

This week, Tim and Tom discuss the new, darker turn Superman has taken in the new Man of Steel movie, memories of the Batman/Superman cartoon show, the finest portrayal of Superman in any medium (Lois and Clark: The New Adventures of Superman), Smallville, the time Superman died and everyone bought a thousand copies of the comic and some other stuff. Also, we argue a lot about Batman, because that's kind of "our thing."

But first, Tom talks about the time he gave some ungrateful young adults directions on the subway and Tim talks about a Foreigner concert he saw at a baseball game. And on a new installment of Tim & Tom Solve Your Problems, we tackle an iPhone-related marital issue and Tim asks listeners to write a theme song for the segment, with a lot of qualifiers.

This week's episode is brought to you by Audible. Get a free audiobook download and 30-day trial by signing up at tcgte.com/audible.

episodes.title: Conspiracy Theories (Retilians, JFK and Dinosaurs) - Live in Manchester on March 18, 2013
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week we're putting out a live episode from our somewhat recent Europe tour. This is the first night in Manchester at The King's Arms. Included are some stories about us visiting an optical illusion museum in Edinburgh and almost missing our flight from Dublin because we're extremely out of shape. This episode also marks the first time Tim tries out some of his new topical political humor on a Manchester audience before we get into the real topic of the show: Conspiracy Theories. We manage to cover reptilian humanoids living amongst us, the connection between the JFK assassination and Billy Joel, as well as whether or not dinosaurs still live.

We also introduce a completely new audience participation segment called "Real Conspiracy Theory or Something Tom Made Up" and trot out an old favorite "The Mundane Bucket List". Before closing out this super-sized episode we also solve some audience problems concerning invisible bears and roommates who lie about attending university.

episodes.title: NYC Tourism Part 1
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week, due to popular demand, we talk about the things that people should do when they visit New York City. Ya know, The Big Apple. The City That Never Sleeps. Birthplace of the Churro. We discuss some of the more touristy destinations like Times Square (particularly the M&Ms Store), the Statue of Liberty and the Empire State Building. This, for some reason, leads to a lot of talk about Roy from Siegfried and Roy.

Before we get into that, though, Tom tells a couple riveting stories about motorcycles and pizza flavored snack food products. Some really great, interesting stories. Then we solve a coward's question in another installment of Tim and Tom Solve Your Problems.

This week's episode is sponsored by Audible. Get a free 30 day trial and a free audiobook download at tcgte.com/audible.

episodes.title: Binge Watching
episodes.author: thecompleteguidetoeverything@gmail.com (Tim Daniels and Tom Reynolds)
episodes.summary:
This week, in honor of the premiere of the new season of Arrested Development, we discuss the new way of watching television (according to blogs): Binge Watching. We share our opinions on the wisdom of watching eight hours of television at one time, the uselessness of Nielsen Ratings and how terrible 24 is when episodes are watched back to back.

But first, we talk about a Jeopardy contestant with a strange anecdote in the contestant interview, Tim gets his hands on a soundboard and Tom gets angry and we pitch an idea for a Netflix series called "House of Cars". After some real talk about "I Love Lucy" we solve a problem from a listener who is having trouble making friends at a new school and offer some tetherball-related advice.
